title: Jaquizaca – a jaunty typeface with a serious attitude
content:
I created [Jaquizaca](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414043637/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lamatas/jaquizaca/) in 2001 to make [inter-titles for a TV programme](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414043637/http:/vimeo.com/74241282). After twelve years it was revised and updated with ligatures, contextual alternates and other OpenType features. It supports all the European languages using Latin alphabet.  
In 2004 I draw [a snakes'n'ladders board](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414043637/http:/origin.myfonts.com/s/aw/original/242/0/124175.pdf) to illustrate a magazine article on graphic design process. Now, with a little help of my friends, I translated it into [English](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414043637/http:/origin.myfonts.com/s/aw/original/242/0/124178.pdf), [Spanish](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414043637/http:/origin.myfonts.com/s/aw/original/242/0/124177.pdf) and [German](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414043637/http:/origin.myfonts.com/s/aw/original/242/0/124176.pdf).

comments.content: Not something I am likely to use in my work, but it is very nice still. Congratulations!
Wouldn't be the least bit surprised to spot it in some kids' or teen magazines later on.
